summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying motions to quash a subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program. The order requires the Program Administrator to produce responsive materials and directs the parties to negotiate a protective order for review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who issued a Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York who issued this order, denying motions to quash a subpoena and setting deadlines for production and a protective order.

persons.name: Administrator Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program who filed a motion to quash the defendant's subpoena and requested oral argument, which was denied.

connections.description: Administrator Feldman, representing the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, moved to quash a subpoena issued by defendant Ghislaine Maxwell for program materials.
Judge Nathan presided over the criminal case against Maxwell and issued this order regarding Maxwell's subpoena for victim compensation program materials.
Judge Nathan ruled on Administrator Feldman's motion to quash a subpoena and denied his request for oral argument.

events.title: Court Order on Subpoena Motions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash a Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

events.title: Deadline for Production and Protective Order
events.description: The court ordered the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to produce responsive materials via electronic thumb drive and for the parties to submit a proposed protective order by 12:00 p.m.

keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
The court ordered the Program Administrator to produce responsive materials by November 24, 2021, for the court's review.
The court directed the parties to negotiate a protective order for reviewing the materials to prevent trial delays.
Administrator Feldman's request for oral argument on the motion to quash was denied.
